title: London Underground: most dangerous tube line revealed
text:
Experts have revealed the London tube lines which suffer from the highest crime rates, and what days are worst hit.

Analysing how crime affects property prices in different areas, property experts at Fastsalehomes.co.uk researched the London tube lines to find out where the majority of thefts take place.

To do this, they obtained data from the British Transport Police, with the infographic revealing that the Piccadilly line suffers the highest crime rate.

Meanwhile the Waterloo and City line boasts the lowest rate, Saturdays see the most thefts taking place - and women emerged as the target of more than half of the crimes.

An exclusive infographic from the British Transport Police revealed that the Piccadilly line suffers the highest crime rate, while the Waterloo and City line boasts the lowest, with Saturdays seeing the most thefts taking place - and women the target of more than half of the crimes. Pictured: The number of annual thefts on the different tube lines.

Research found that the number of thefts reported on the tube has increased by 14 per cent this year compared to the year 2018.

The number of thefts on the underground have gone from 5,587 reports (Jul 2017- Jul 2018), to 6,405 reports (from Sept 2018 – Sept 2019.)

The Piccadilly line emerged as the most dangerous London Underground line with 1,110 thefts reported in 2019, while the Waterloo and City line is the safest line, with only nine thefts reported in 2019.

Saturday is the worst day for being robbed on the underground, with 21 per cent of thefts taking place on the first day of the weekend.

Perhaps not surprisingly, 62 per cent of the thefts involve women as the victim, whereas only 36 per cent of theft victims on the underground are men.

Interestingly Monday and Tuesday emerged as the safest days to travel, with only 12 per cent of thefts taking place.

The central line was the second most dangerous line to travel on, with 991 thefts reported, followed by the Victoria line at 971 thefts, the Northern line at 848 and the Jubilee at just 763.

The Waterloo and City line won the title of the safest line was followed by the London overground with 24, Docklands railway at 92, the Metropolitan line with 166 and the Hammersmith and City line with 364 thefts.
